private_information: I can only manipulate blocks whose labels are vowels
Vowel blocks in this problem are A, E, I
I can only move one top block at a time
I can only interact with blocks that are currently at the top of a stack
vowel_agent.goal: Collaborate to rearrange the blocks from the initial configuration to the target tower while only moving vowel-labelled top blocks when possible

private_information: I can only manipulate blocks whose labels are consonants
Consonant blocks in this problem are B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L, M, N
I can only move one top block at a time
I can only interact with blocks that are currently at the top of a stack
consonant_agent.goal: Collaborate to rearrange the blocks from the initial configuration to the target tower while only moving consonant-labelled top blocks when possible

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and integrate their observations and proposals
I produce the final planning problem and domain suitable for the FastDownwards solver
orchestrator.goal: Produce a combined PDDL domain and problem encoding the full multi-agent block rearrangement task so FastDownwards can solve it

public_information: There are 14 uniquely labeled blocks: I H E B M D K L J N A F G C
Agents can only manipulate blocks that are currently at the top of a stack
Agents can move exactly one block at a time from the top of a stack to the top of another stack or to the table
One agent may only move vowel-labelled blocks
The other agent may only move consonant-labelled blocks
Initial stacks from bottom to top are: H B D K J; I L C; E N A; M F G

Initial explicit relations: I is on the table. H is on the table. E is on the table. B is on top of H. M is on the table. D is on top of B. K is on top of D. L is on top of I. J is on top of K. N is on top of E. A is on top of N. F is on top of M. G is on top of F. C is on top of L.
Goal relations from bottom to top are: N on table, M on N, L on M, K on L, J on K, I on J, H on I, G on H, F on G, E on F, D on E, C on D, B on C, A on B
Only top blocks of each stack are available to be moved at any time
Maintain the uniqueness and identity of each block label throughout planning

analyze.system_prompt: You are a block-manipulation agent restricted to vowel-labelled blocks. Provide factual observations about which vowel blocks you are allowed to move, which of those are currently at the top of stacks, and list possible single-step moves you can perform given the public initial configuration. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on local feasibility, constraints, and any ambiguities you detect in the public information.
analyze.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. You have access to the public information about the blocks and the initial configuration. Using your private knowledge that you may only move vowel-labelled blocks A, E, and I, report the subset of those that are currently top blocks. For each such top vowel block, list the legal single-block moves you could perform (move to table or move on top of another stack top). If a vowel block is not currently top, state which block is above it. Provide any assumptions you need to make explicit. Output should be a structured report of observations and candidate moves.

analyze.system_prompt: You are a block-manipulation agent restricted to consonant-labelled blocks. Provide factual observations about which consonant blocks you are allowed to move, which of those are currently at the top of stacks, and list possible single-step moves you can perform given the public initial configuration. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on local feasibility, constraints, and any ambiguities you detect in the public information.
analyze.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. You have access to the public information about the blocks and the initial configuration. Using your private knowledge that you may only move consonant-labelled blocks B C D F G H J K L M N, report the subset of those that are currently top blocks. For each such top consonant block, list the legal single-block moves you could perform (move to table or move on top of another stack top). If a consonant block is not currently top, state which block is above it. Provide any assumptions you need to make explicit. Output should be a structured report of observations and candidate moves.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator that must integrate observations from the two agents and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Keep the agents' capabilities distinct in the domain by encoding action preconditions that restrict which agent can perform which actions, based on vowel or consonant block labels. Represent block-on relations, on-table relations, clear/top predicates, and single-block move actions for each agent. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target FastDownwards compatibility in the produced PDDL.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You receive the following reports from the agents. Integrate them with the public environment description and produce a full PDDL domain and a PDDL problem encoding the initial state and the goal state. Use separate action names or agent parameters to keep vowel_agent actions and consonant_agent actions distinct. Ensure preconditions enforce top-of-stack and label restrictions. Target FastDownwards compatibility. Here is the vowel agent report: {vowel_report}. Here is the consonant agent report: {consonant_report}. Provide the PDDL domain and PDDL problem. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
